scenes.title: Introduction: The Color Dimension Problem
scenes.narration_summary: Hook with the paradox of human vs mantis shrimp color discrimination despite vastly different receptor counts, and introduction to the need for a quantitative framework.

scenes.title: The Markov Polytope as Experiential Arena
scenes.narration_summary: Explain Hoffman's formalism: conscious agents, qualia kernels, Markov polytope dimension D=k(k-1), and the fusion simplex.

scenes.title: Defining Perceptual Efficiency η
scenes.narration_summary: Define η = B/D where B is spectral JND hue steps and D is polytope dimension; explain interpretation of high vs low η.

scenes.title: Empirical Data Across Species
scenes.narration_summary: Present the data table for 6 species (dog to mantis shrimp), show η calculation, and reveal the inverse scaling trend.
animations: Show η values and trend line

scenes.title: Two Regimes: Amplification vs Decoding
scenes.narration_summary: Explain the two processing regimes: cortical amplification for low k (high η) vs interval decoding for high k (low η), driven by resource constraints.

scenes.title: Falsifiable Predictions
scenes.narration_summary: Outline key predictions: scaling law, tetrachromacy efficiency, and engineering implications for synthetic sensors.

scenes.title: Conclusion: Polytope Compression Hypothesis
scenes.narration_summary: Summarize the hypothesis: adding sensory channels without deepening processing collapses experience into coarser regimes.

scenes.title: Recap: Key Takeaways
scenes.narration_summary: Final summary restating the metric, empirical results, theoretical framework, and implications for consciousness and sensory design.
